metadata.synopsis: Robotics prodigy Hiro (Ryan Potter) lives in the city of San Fransokyo. Next to his older brother, Tadashi, Hiro's closest companion is Baymax (Scott Adsit), a robot whose sole purpose is to take care of people. When a devastating turn of events throws Hiro into the middle of a dangerous plot, he transforms Baymax and his other friends, Go Go Tamago (Jamie Chung), Wasabi (Damon Wayans Jr.), Honey Lemon (Genesis Rodriguez) and Fred (T.J. Miller) into a band of high-tech heroes.

reviews: There are set pieces in Big Hero 6 that rival anything from the Marvel imaginations.
I'm sure many people, young and old, will go into Big Hero 6 and enjoy themselves. I just wished there was more going on here.
102 minutes of perpetual amazement that greatly complicated the choice of the best animation film of 2014. [Full Review in Spanish]
There's definitely a little something for everyone in this movie. Humor that both parents and kids can enjoy... a touching story, and action in every turn.
Big Hero 6 is a fun, occasionally brilliant, never boring computer-animated film from Disney.
Soaring with action, adventure, charm, heart, soul and a whole lot of fun - not to mention Baymax, one of the most adorable heroes ever... Big Hero 6 is the new big screen hero!
Big Hero 6 is sweet and stunning and in Baymax, Disney has its new Totoro.
The oversized and awkward, cute and caring Baymax could easily be the preferred stocking stuffing this Christmas.
Though heart and humour may be ever-present, Big Hero 6's most welcome attribute lies within its gleeful sense of perpetual imagination.
It is, after all, the Baymax show -- and he is cute, cuddly, comedy gold. Fortunately, although Big Hero 6 has various flaws, he's generally on hand to patch them.
A really nice entry into the Disney canon.
Big Hero 6 may not have the heft of other commentaries on the superhero genre, but it has an emotional heart unlike any other.
Big Hero 6 will entertain and amuse most, especially if you're a 10-year-old boy, but for me, it's only saving grace was a big, huggable robot.
Grandes héroes es una hilarante animación con sobra de corazón sobre un grupo de héroes en proceso.
[Baymax is] funny and squishy and over-concerned and allows for the same sort of secretive wonder kids got out of E.T. a few decades back.
BIG HERO 6 isn't a miserable experience by any stretch, but this effort from Disney is uninspired and has some odd political aspects
A family film that doesn't pander to its audience, a comic book film that [isn't] dark and gritty, and a Disney film without talking animals. Now that definitely IS heroic.
Big Hero 6 is about dealing with loss; the symptoms it causes, what happens when that loss makes you do bad things, and how to move on comfortably.
Big Hero 6 feels like its been made by committee.
It takes a lot to make an animated movie feel heartwarming, but Disney pulled it off while not sacrificing the dazzling animations for which they are known.
